page.title: 03The Mayor of Peterborough
page.content:
As Mayor of Peterborough, I am pleased to introduce readers of the new Domesday Book to the City of 1986.
Peterborough is a growing city which has almost doubled to its present population of over 140,000 in fifteen years. It is a young city with 24% of its people aged under 16. It is a lively city whose business, shopping, sporting and recreational facilities are of the highest quality.
As we move towards the 1990's, I have every confidence that the citizens, their elected Council and all who work in industry and commerce in the City will make Peterborough a still better place for our children and the future generations who may read this message.
{R.E.Burke,}Mayor of Peterborough
